definitions.definition: To depart; to go to another place.
definitions.example: At 9 o'clock sharp he awayed to bed.

definitions.definition: Not here, gone, absent, unavailable, traveling; on vacation.
definitions.example: The master is away from home.

definitions.definition: At a specified distance in space, time, or figuratively.

definitions.example: Next, they are playing away in Dallas.
Two men away in the bottom of the ninth.
I tried to approach him, but he turned away.

definitions.definition: Aside, so as to discard something.
definitions.example: throw away, chuck away, toss away

definitions.definition: At a stated distance in time or space.
definitions.example: Christmas is only two weeks away.

definitions.definition: In or to something's usual or proper storage place.
definitions.example: I'll dry the dishes and you put them away.

definitions.definition: In or to a secure or out-of-the-way place.
definitions.example: He was shut away in the castle tower for six months.

definitions.definition: From a state or condition of being; out of existence.
So as to remove or use up something.
definitions.example: Please wipe away this spilled drink.

definitions.definition: (as imperative, by ellipsis) Come away; go away; take away.
definitions.example: Away! Be gone! And don't let me see you round here again!

definitions.definition: On; in continuance; without intermission or delay.
definitions.example: She's been in her room all day, working away at her computer.
I saw her whaling away at her detractors.
